title: Share of deaths that are registered
owidProcessingLevel: Processed by Our World in Data
subtitle: The number of deaths reported in a country's vital registration system as a share of total expected deaths. Expected deaths are taken as the average of estimates from three international sources: the UN, WHO, and IHME.

descriptionFromSource.title: How does the source – Ariel Karlinsky (2021) – describe this metric?

relatedResearch.title: World Population Growth
authors: Max Roser, Hannah Ritchie, Esteban Ortiz-Ospina and Lucas Rodés-Guirao

relatedResearch.title: Causes of death
authors: Hannah Ritchie, Fiona Spooner, Max Roser

relatedData.title: Share of deaths for which the cause is registered
relatedData.content: The share of deaths that have been registered with a cause of death.

relatedData.title: Share of births that are registered
relatedData.content: The percentage of children under age 5 whose births were registered at the time of the survey.

relatedData.title: Deaths registered with an ill-defined cause of death
relatedData.content: The share of total deaths that were registered with an ill-defined cause of death.

relatedData.title: World population living in countries with cause-of-death registration

datasetName: Ariel Karlinsky (2021) – Processed and adapted by Our World in Data

datasetFeaturedVariables.variableSubtitle: CO₂ emissions from fossil fuels and industry, adjusted for trade

datasetFeaturedVariables.variableName: Annual CO₂ emissions from land-use change per capita
